title: BBC Local Live: East Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire - BBC News
summary: body found after grimsby flat fire .
open bridges will 'split hull in two ' .
future 's bright for sports clubs in hornsea .
art for art 's sake in hull .
increase in referrals to children 's charity in area .

documents.title: castleford 16-48 hull fc
text: castleford 16-48 hull fc

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all from me for today .
we 'll be back on monday morning from 08:00 .
before i go , here 's five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: can you help find david cartwright ?
text: there 's concern for the safety of david cartwright who 's been missing from his home since 13 september .
david , who 's 34 and has some health issues was last seen at his home in hull .
it 's thought he has some family in the leeds area .
police are asking for anyone who may know where david is or have seen him to call them on the 101 number .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sport : castleford tigers v hull fc
text: hull fc 's mark minichiello believes their big game experience in the last two years will benefit them as they look to seal a playoff place at castleford tonight .
following st helens ' victory last night the black and white 's must avoid defeat at the jungle to ensure fifth-placed wigan ca n't catch them .
tonight 's big match commentary can be heard on all frequencies , online and freeview channel 721 with team news and early build-up in sportstalk from 18:00 .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: help police find missing teenager owen smith
text: police are asking for your help to find a missing teenager from hull .
owen smith who 's 15-years-old has n't been since since he left his home on hemswell drive on monday morning .
if you 've seen owen or know where he is you are being asked to call the 101 number .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull trinity festival - bringing the old town to life
text: hull will come alive with the sound of live music again this weekend .
hull trinity festival will see bands taking to the stage at zebedee 's yard and venues across in the city .
happy endings ( and the talks are the headline acts with other local bands performing over saturday and sunday .
author: James Hoggarth
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: more detail on house blast inquest
text: the death of a man after an explosion at a hull flat was accidental , a coroner has ruled .
lewis nicklin , 31 , was rescued from the property on beverley road on 10 march .
he later died in hospital .
the inquest at hull coroner 's court heard mr nicklin died from a combination of carbon monoxide poisoning and the effects of taking drugs .
the court heard the explosion happened when a fire crew entered the kitchen to try and extinguish a cooker fire in mr nicklin 's ground-floor flat .
the rush of oxygen into the room triggered a fireball which ignited the gas supply .
fire investigation officer andy kamis told the court it was believed the initial fire was caused by alcohol wipes being heated in the oven .
author: Stuart Harratt
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : a round up of the weekend 's weather
text: here 's a look at the weather for the next few days with me abbie dewhurst :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingaccidental death verdict in beverley road explosion
text: a coroner has ruled that 31-year-old lewis nicklin died as a result of an accident .
lewis was found following an explosion at a flat on beverley road in hull in march .
he later died in hospital .
the inquest heard lewis died from a combination of carbon monoxide poisoning and the effects of taking drugs .
the building exploded shortly after emergency services arrived .
they 'd been called out to a fire that started in the kitchen that led to a gas explosion .
author: Leanne Brown
BBC Look North

documents.title: light fantastic future for north lincolnshire 's streets
text: a £ 6m project to replace street lights in north lincolnshire with more energy efficient ones is due to get under way next week .
the council say the new lights will use up to 75 % less energy and save them around £ 500,000 once the work 's done .
it currently costs north linclonshire council £ 1m a year to light our streets .
it 'll take three years to replace all 21,000 light bulbs .
author: Sophia Ewen
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: real cost of missed hospital appointments is £ 11m
text: missed hospital appointments cost the hull and east yorkshire hospitals nhs trust £ 11m last year .
that 's the same as 440 nursing jobs .
almost 67,000 out-patient appointments were missed at hull royal and castle hill hospitals .
the trust say missed appointments mean longer waiting lists and are asking people to let them know in advance if they ca n't make an appointment .
author: Vicky Johnson
BBC Look North

documents.title: lobster law brought in to protect species
text: wildlife experts say a new law to protect yorkshire 's east coast lobsters will ensure the creature and the fishermen who depend on it have a long-term future .
the shellfish industry in bridlington , hornsea and withernsea is the biggest in europe .
the new restrictions on catching female lobsters come into force next month .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: yorkshire beat bears to ease drop fears
text: yorkshire beat bears to ease drop fears

documents.title: man in hospital following a180 crash
text: a man has been taken to hospital following a crash near grimsby this morning .
the accident involving two cars happened just off the a180 at the pyewipe roundabout around 06:30 .
a renault megane and an audi q5 collided .
the driver of the renault vehicle was taken to hospital with minor injuries .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: turner prize shortlisted artists : lubaina himid
text: as the turner prize edges ever closer to opening its doors at ferens art gallery in hull , we 're taking a look at the four artists who have been shortlisted for this year 's prize .
the turner prize is a world renowned art prize awarded by the tate to an artist who 's exhibited outstanding work in the previous year .
so far we 've heard from hurvin anderson and andrea buttner and today we 'll hear from lubaina himid .
we 've still to hear from rosalind nashashibi before the exhibition opens on tuesday 26 september .
the winner of this year 's turner prize will be announced at the end of december .
meet lubaina , turner prize 2017 shortlisted artist .
26 sep 2017 - 7 jan 2018 @ twitterid / / # turnerprize / @ twitterid
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: more than 60,000 people sign petition to save dog
text: a petition 's been launched by a local woman to save a dog which a court ordered should be put down after leaving a toddler needing plastic surgery .

although the dog was on a lead when the boy approached and tried to cuddle him , beverley magistrates court ( found that the dog was `` dangerously out of control '' and ordered the dog 's owner to pay £ 7,000 in damages .
magistrates said they were not satisfied that the dog was n't a danger to the public .
but sheena louise from south killingholme wants to save jed and instead of him being put down wants him to wear a muzzle in public .
she 's started a petition which has been signed over 60,000 times .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: a sign of the times in hull
text: have you ever looked at a road sign and thought of art ?
no !
well you 'll soon be able to see a new exhibition which takes our road signs and gives them a twist :
here 's sir terrance conran 's rather gory sign warning cyclists of the dangers of sharing the roads with trucks
our street signs were originally designed over 50 years ago by margaret calvert and jock kinnear and roughly circles give us instructions , triangles warn and rectangles inform .
a new exhibition , 'made north ' at humber street gallery in hull , which is curated by patrick murphy , is taking those classic signs and asking leading designers and artists to reinterpret them .
here 's a cheeky directions sign by the actor mark bonner
there are 80 signs to identify and these will be displayed in and humber street gallery and surrounding streets from 2 october .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: house explosion death inquest opens in hull
text: an inquest into the death of a man killed in an explosion in hull earlier this year is being held today .
lewis nicklin , aged 31 , died following a fire at a house on beverley road in the city back in march .
the building exploded shortly after emergency services arrived .
two firefighters were also treated in hospital for minor injuries .
author: Jo Makel
BBC Look North

documents.title: fatal house fire in grimsby
text: one person has died in a house fire in grimsby .
fire crews were called to a flat in purbeck road , scartho ( just before 02:00 this morning .
other flats in the building were evacuated and police have confirmed that a body was found in one of the flats .
a cordon is in place and police are investigating .
they want to hear from anyone who was in the area at the time .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: want to tell us about your unsung hero ?
text: do you know someone who helps out at your local sports team or club ?
is this a person who you just could n't cope without ?
t./hen you should think about nominating them for an unsung hero award .
every year the bbc honours the people who volunteer by running sports clubs or leisure activities across east yorkshire and lincolnshire .
last year table tennis coach sylvia worth ( won the award for her work in sancton .
you can nominate your unsung hero by visiting bbc.co.uk/unsunghero .
entries close on the 22 october .
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: is this the first frost of the autumn ?
text: it 's officially autumn !
the autumn equinox falls on the 22 september this year .
that means there is the same amount of day as there is night .
12 hours of each .
and as if to herald in the coming cold weather , here 's a couple of of what could be our first frost of the season and some autumnal from our weather watchers :
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: boxing - we 're cheering from campbell 's corner
text: five years after he thrilled us all by winning gold for hull in the olympic games , luke campbell comes up against what could be the most important fight of his life this weekend .
he 's taking on venezuala 's jorge linares for the wba lightweight crown in los angeles .
the fight will take place at 03:00 on sunday morning gmt .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: large rise in referrals to nspcc in yorkshire and humber
text: there 's been a significant increase in the number of referrals to the nspcc children 's charity in yorkshire and humber , it 's been revealed .
the charity made 450 referrals to child protection agencies in the region last year following reports of children being affected by domestic abuse - a 28 % increase from the previous year .
overall , the rspcc says it received nearly 5,000 calls reporting domestic abuse across the uk in 2016-17 .

documents.title: future 's bright for sports clubs in hornsea
text: there 's relief among sports clubs in hornsea who were afraid they 'd be thrown out of their leagues .
a shortage of trustees at the charity which manages hornsea 's playing fields , meant clubs might have to stop using the facilities .
the clubs could have played elsewhere , but those grounds do n't meet football and cricket league standards .
geoff whitehead ( tells us the future looks brighter , now more volunteers have been found to help run hollis recreation ground in hornsea .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: art for art 's sake in hull
text: work is under way on the latest city of culture art installation in hull .
sixteen huge steel columns will be arranged in a grid in front of hull minster and people will be able to go inside the exhibit called 'a hall for hull ' .
the artwork is the latest in a series that included the blade which was in queen victoria square at the start of the year .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: open bridges - splitting hull in two
text: you 're being reminded of the closure of hull 's 13 bridges at 20:17 tonight .
the bridges will be closed for one minute with the idea of temporarily splitting the city in two and highlighting the vital role they play in our everyday lives .
music , which has been specially composed for the event , will be premiered at the stage at the dock from 19:30 .
motorists please be aware that at 20:17 tonight,13 bridges across hull will closed for 1 minute .
for more info visit
'always it is by bridges that we live ,
it 's almost high tide then , any plan to get a speedboat going up the river under all the bridges ?
that would of been a great idea ! ! !
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 16th for sep 22 . )
i like the idea , but the listed scott st bridge has been closed for years .
how about @ twitterid legacy of working bridges ?
@ twitterid
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store for friday ?
text: a dry start but the chance of some rain later .
here 's a look at the full forecast for the day with me abbie dewhurst :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning , gill here with the day 's news , sport , travel and weather updates across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
i 'll be with you until 18:00 today .
it 's looking like it will be a brighter day once the early mist has lifted .
here 's a of the cows next to beverley minster hiding in the mist this morning :
if you want to get in touch with your or stories you can email us or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

BBC Local Live

documents.title: hull kr 's tim sheens adds experience to his squad for warrington game
text: hull kr 's tim sheens adds experience to his squad for warrington game

documents.title: cycling record attempt comes to scunthorpe
text: cyclist chris hopkinson ( will attempt to beat 11 world records at scunthorpe velodrome next week .
he 's hoping to beat the 24 hour outdoor track world record as well as 10 other records next friday .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: armed police hunt intruders in grimsby
text: armed police in grimsby are searching for two men who broke into a woman 's house and threatened her last night .
it happened on highfield avenue just before midnight .
the woman who was in the house with her children was left upset and shaken but was n't hurt .
the men drove off in a gold or silver-coloured car and police are appealing for information .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: this looks like a cozy venue !
text: how does this look for a night out ?
a nordic style bar/tipi is coming to @ twitterid this winter - with open fire , real ales & mulled wine .
@ twitterid is behind it .
sounds gr8
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: event encourages next generation of female engineers
text: an event 's been taking place in scunthorpe today to encourage more women to take up engineering roles .
it was at humber utc , an £ 11mfacility focusing on engineering .

it comes as girl guiding release a report finding gender stereotypes are impacting the behaviour of girls as young as seven , which is shutting women out of certain sectors , like engineering and construction .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: sport : hull fc team news
text: hull fc coach lee radford has confirmed fetuli talanoa ( will be in their side for tomorrow 's potentially crucial game at castleford tomorrow .
the winger has missed the last two games due to a hyper-extended elbow .
the black and white 's play-off place could already be secure even before tomorrow 's game if st helens fail to win at salford tonight .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: 'recruitment pressures ' cause ward closure
text: 'recruitment pressures ' cause ward closure

documents.title: canine kit to avert catastrophe in house fires
text: humberside fire and rescue service has been given some specialist equipment - to help save more pets from house fires .
animals will now be treated with specially-designed oxygen masks to help with resuscitation .
they 've been provided by a company that teaches people how to give first aid to dogs .
kerry rhodes from rhodes 2 safety says pets are part of the family and now can be given the same level of care by firefighters as humans .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sport : hull kr team announced
text: hull kingston rovers name their final 19-man squad of the season to face warrington .
ben cockayne is included for what will be his last game for rovers .
here is our 19-man squad to face warrington this saturday # comeonrovers
is justin carney injured ?
he up a hamstring injury at fev , must still be troubling him .
where 's shaun lunt have n't seen last 2 match
shaun has had a problem with his shoulder .
having keyhole surgery to clear it out .
there was me thinking he was coming back to town best of luck with the op @ twitterid
liked to have seen jordan abdul play his last game for us .
why isi n't horne playing .
if the rumours are true that he is leaving at the end of the season , that 's a shame .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: weather : bring your brolly !
text: it 's looking like it 's going to be a wet afternoon but tomorrow is looking brighter .
here 's the full forecast with me paul hudson :
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : this week 's city of culture highlights
text: your photos could end up on beer mats in hull pubs !
kofi smiles has the latest on that and more from the city of culture :
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: are children getting fatter in the east riding ?
text: roughly a third of 10 and 11-year-olds in the east riding are overweight or obese .
the figures are from the national child measurement programme .
efforts have been made in the past to reduce obesity levels , with some schools banning sweets and chocolate and the introduction of the sugar tax last year .
today health experts will meet with the east riding council to try and tackle the problem .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: turner prize finalist : andrea buttner
text: the world renowned turner prize will open in hull next week .
the four finalists , hurvin anderson , andrea buttner , lubaina himid and rosalind nashashibi will exhibit their work at the ferens art gallery until early january .
it 's the first time the turner prize has been held outside london .
in december the winner will be announced , so we 're taking a look at the artists and their work .
yesterday we heard from hurvin anderson and today is the turn of andrea buttner :
meet andrea , turner prize 2017 shortlisted artist .
26 sep 2017 - 7 jan 2018 @ twitterid / / # turnerprize / @ twitterid
i read that as anthea turner .
interesting plot twist .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: calling all would-be entrepreneurs in grimsby
text: a dragon 's den style competition in grimsby is looking to find the next great business idea .
freshney place shopping centre 's apprentice retailer of the year is on today .
they 'll offer one entrepreneur the chance to bring their idea to life , with a six-month tenancy at a unit within the shopping centre - free of rent , rates and service charges .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: petition to cut councillor 's allowances
text: calls are being made for north east lincolnshire councillors allowances to be reduced .
a grimsby man 's got 1,600 people to sign his petition which will be handed over to the council tonight .
he says with cuts to services councillors should take a cut in their allowances too .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: sport : luke campbell focused before saturday 's big fight
text: luke campbell does n't believe he 'll be overawed by the occasion when he seeks to win his first world title in los angeles on saturday night .
ahead of his fight with jorge linares for the wba lightweight crown , campbell is remaining focused .
he told us he 's had hundreds of fights and this is just another one between two boxers in the ring .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: watch : hull city council meeting stopped due to protest
text: protesters brought a halt to today 's full council meeting at hull 's guildhall .
members of the gmb union targeted the meeting to call for better standards in the city 's construction industry .
they want the council to sign a charter meaning any company wanting to operate in the city would have to reach certain standards :
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: calls to scrap bus lanes in grimsby
text: bus lanes in grimsby are a waste of time and causing more congestion .
that 's from a conservative councillor in the town who wants to see a review of bus lanes in grimsby .
ian lyndley will tell full council tonight in north east lincolnshire that he thinks the bus lanes on scartho road ( make traffic worse and there 's no enforcement of them .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: britain 's got talent auditions in hull
text: auditions for the tv show britain 's got talent are in hull today .
they 're taking place at the princess quay shopping centre from noon .
hull singer calum scott ( finished sixth in the series in 2015 .
singers , magicians acrobats or any other performers can go along .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: town hall upgrade 'double original estimate '
text: it will cost £ 3m to refurbish bridlington town hall (
that 's double the original estimate .
the news was given to members of the east riding 's cabinet earlier this week .
a new customer services centre will be created and the council chamber will be modernised .
jobcentre staff will also move in .
officials say the increased cost is due partly to including maintenance work that will have long-term benefits .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: breakinggmb union protest halts council meeting
text: councillors in hull have had to leave the full council meeting due to a protest by the gmb union .
they are demonstrating outside the guildhall this morning .
protesters are calling for fair pay and safety standards in the city 's construction industry .
protesters say they want the council to sign up to a charter protecting construction workers ' rights , meaning any company wanting to operate in the city would have to reach certain standards .

documents.title: 'bigger names , greater prestige ' for extended tour de yorkshire
text: the extension of the tour de yorkshire from three to four days next year will bring `` far-reaching '' benefits to the county , the event 's organisers have promised .
announcing that the tour will run from thursday 3 may to sunday 6 may 2018 , welcome to yorkshire chief executive sir gary verity says it 's `` absolutely tremendous news '' .
`` this decision will help us attract even bigger names in the future and allow us to design a more varied and spectacular route , '' says sir gary .
`` our race is growing in stature all the time and the next two editions will hold even greater prestige given that yorkshire is also hosting the uci road world championships in 2019 . ''

documents.title: here 's how your aid to freetown was used
text: if you donated food , clothing or equipment to help the people affected by august 's mudslide in hull 's twin town of freetown then this is what happened to it :
the devastating mudslide left hundreds dead and thousands homeless in the regent district of freetown in sierra leone .
the freetown society in hull raised £ 7,000 and the send a child to school charity £ 2,500 .
today @ twitterid handed out school equipment and uniform purchased using our donations .
these 100 children are ready to return to school
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingtour de yorkshire to grow to four days
text: it 's just been announced that an extra day is to be added to the tour de yorkshire from 2018 .
cycling 's governing body the uci has confirmed the men 's race will grow to four days and the women 's event will also be increasing to two days .
the popular cycling race was first launched in 2015 , following on from the tour de france 's grand depart that was held in the county the year before .
around 2.2m fans lined the route of this year 's event and it was broadcast live in 180 countries around the world .
the race also brought in an estimated £ 64m for the region 's economy .
this decision will help us attract even bigger names in the future and allow us to design a more varied and spectacular route ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: culture city wins enterprising gong
text: hull has been crowned the most enterprising place in britain by the government for its `` economic growth '' .
the current uk city of culture won two categories in the department for business , energy & industrial strategy 's enterprising britain awards .
it was praised for its investment in education and training programmes and its ventures in renewable energy , including siemens ' £ 310m wind turbine blade factory .
judges acknowledged the city had `` 5,000 more jobs and 6,800 more people in employment now compared to 2011 '' .
i want to congratulate the city of hull for their enormous success .
they are a fantastic example of what can be achieved by applying an innovative approach to supporting businesses , and i wish them continued success .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: concerns over temporary closure of bridlington hospital ward
text: jean wormwell is from bridlington and she 's angry about the closure of a ward for elderly patients at the town 's hospital .
the york trust said bridlington hospital was a jewel in the crown so why are they decreasing our services there instead of increasing them .
if they are closing a ward at this time of year what about winter pressures ?
i think it 's an awful time to close a ward . ''
york teaching hospital nhs foundation trust confirmed that the waters ward - which is an 11-bed ward for elderly patients - will be temporarily closed due to `` recruitment pressures . ''
they say the ward 's often not used to its full capacity and the staff are needed on other wards where there is greater demand .
but that 's not gone down too well with local residents who believe this is one step closer to the hospital being closed for good .
author: Sally Fairfax
BBC Radio Humberside Live

documents.title: cleethorpes gets £ 2m towards streets makeover
text: shop fronts in cleethorpes town centre will be getting a makeover thanks to almost £ 2m of lottery funding .
north east lincolnshire council has been awarded £ 1.9m to help enhance the historic character of the town .
the 'discover cleethorpes heritage ' programme is a five-year regeneration scheme with the majority of funds available as grants to building owners to repair and reinstate original features .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: watch : today 's weather forecast
text: it 's a bit milder than of late but we could see a bit of rain too .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning , gill here with the day 's news , sport , travel and weather across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
there is a flood alert in place first thing this morning due to strong winds and waves .
it 's in the humber estuary from spurn point to winestead outfall and will last till 08:30 this morning .
a flood alert means flooding is possible so be aware .
a second flood alert , which was in place for this morning on the north sea coast at bridlington was due to clear by 08:00 .
if you want to get in touch with you stories or you can email us or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

before i go , here 's five things we 've learned today :

BBC Local Live

documents.title: £ 10,000 cctv system for driffield
text: driffield town council has overseen the installation of a new cctv system stretching from north end park to the railway station ( riverhead and beverley road .
the network has cost just under £ 10,000 .
criminals are being warned driffield 's new cctv system will capture their faces in pin-sharp quality
about time really , if theme parks snap a pic when the ride zooms round 100mph , i wonder why cctv cameras ca n't get a pic of someone walking
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: pm nominates hull musician for award
text: a musician from hull has been nominated by the prime minister to receive an award .
theresa may recommended daz sims for the `` point of light '' award to recognise the money he has raised for charity .
daz organises the rock 4 charity concerts in hull and around the uk .
the award is given to outstanding volunteers who are making a change in their community and inspire others .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a chance of some rain
text: it will be a mostly cloudy night with a little patchy rain spreading from the west .
minimum temperatures will be around 12c ( 54f ) .
tomorrow will start with a dry morning with bright or sunny intervals but turning wet later in the afternoon as rain spreads from the west .
highs tomorrow of 18c ( 64f ) .
friday should be mostly dry with sunny spells .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: non-emergency police line out of action
text: humberside police have tweeted that their non-emergency 101 number is not working properly at the moment .
they stress that the emergency 999 number is unaffected but ask people to only use it if it is a genuine emergency .
we are currently experiencing problems with our 101 line .
999 is unaffected but please only use this number in an emergency .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sport : bignot 's back in the game
text: former grimsby town manager marcus bignot has his first job in football since leaving the mariners .
he 's become manager of national league strugglers chester .
| breaking : we are delighted to announce the appointment of marcus bignot as first team manager .
# coyb
worst day ever
conference north !
we 're havin a laugh
sam are the chester safe financially yet ?
we 're better off than we were a month ago after all this fundraising , just need to make more money every month and carry on raising money now for the rest of the season
scenes when jon wins the lottery and buys chester and leads them to glory

documents.title: court puts bite on dog owner over microchip details
text: a dog owner from bridlington 's been fined £ 120 because he did n't update the details on his dog 's microchip .
it only costs around £ 16 to change the information .
adrian walker from elma avenue had been told the details needed updating by a kennels owned by east riding council back in march .
the 58-year-old was then reminded a number of times by dog wardens but failed to update the information .
walker admitted not keeping the microchip data up to date and has been fined at beverley magistrates court (
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: renowned album sleeves exhibition honours hull photographer
text: renowned album sleeves produced by a hull-born photographer have gone on display in the city .
mike oldfield 's tubular bells record cover was among a crop created by photographer trevor key .
he also worked with artists jamie reid on the sex pistols releases and with factory records designer peter saville on new order 's sleeves including technique and true faith .
a selection of key 's artwork is being shown at the hull school of art and design .

titled trevor key 's top 40 , the exhibition also features sleeves he designed for omd ( orchestral manoeuvres in the dark ) , german bands can and tangerine dream , as well as comedy duo peter cook and dudley moore 's derek and clive act .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: breakingflood alert issued for bridlington
text: a flood alert 's been issued for the north sea coast at bridlington meaning flooding is possible so people should be prepared .
high winds and waves could lead to some spray and over-topping between 17:30 and 19:00 today and 04:00 and 08:00 tomorrow .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: 'hairline crack ' in tank caused acid leak at hull docks
text: a 30ft high cylindrical storage tank that leaked 500 metric tonnes of hydrochloric acid at king george dock in hull was caused by a `` hairline crack '' , owners have said .
united molasses said the crack was in the tank and apologised for the incident .
a 500-m exclusion zone , which was put in place yesterday morning , has been lifted and all the acid has been cleared from the port .
working closely with the relevant authorities , we acted immediately to contain the leak , which was caused by a hairline crack and alleviated by the tank 's protective bund .
the tank is now empty , and our focus shifts to removing final materials and ensuring investigations into the issue run smoothly .
associated british ports ( abp ) said a second storage tank on the same site would be emptied for `` precautionary measures '' .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: countdown to the turner prize
text: just six days to go until the turner prize exhibition opens at hull 's ferens art gallery .
the four shortlisted artists ( will exhibit their work here in hull from 26 september until december when the winner will be announced .
the turner prize is renowned throughout the world and is given to an artist who 's exhibited outstanding work the year before .
the four nominees are hurvin anderson , andrea buttner , lubaina himid and rosalind nashashibi .
here 's a preview of hurvin anderson 's work :
meet hurvin , turner prize 2017 shortlisted artist .
26 sep 2017 - 7 jan 2018 @ twitterid / / # turnerprize / @ twitterid
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: exclusion zone lifted after acid leak
text: exclusion zone lifted after acid leak

documents.title: cyclist hurt by wire strung across path at head height
text: a cyclist in hull has been injured after he rode into a wire which was strung up across a cycle path (
the wire was placed at head height and caused injury to his neck as he cycled along the path at around 19:30 on monday 18 september .
police have confirmed they 're looking at cctv to try and find the person who put up the wire along bankside on monday evening and are appealing for information .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: yorkshire v warwickshire under way again at headingley
text: yorkshire 's cricketers are currently batting in their county championship clash with warwickshire at headingley .
the tykes bowled the bears out for 219 yesterday and are currently looking to build a substantial first innings lead to help ensure their first division status for next season .
you can listen to ball-by-ball commentary of the match here .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: yorkshire 's bairstow stars in england odi win
text: yorkshire 's jonny bairstow made 100 not out as england 's cricketers beat the windies in the first one day international at old trafford last night .
the hosts chased down their target of 210 with 10 overs to spare to win by seven wickets .
here are some highlights from the match :
the second match of the series takes place tomorrow at trent bridge .
you can listen to ball-by-ball commentary of the game and watch in-play highlights via the bbc sport website and app .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: do you recognise any of these items ? police want to hear from owners
text: police in bridlington are trying to find the owners of these items that have been stolen from cars in the town :
officers found three sat navs , a cd changer and dvd player at a house in bridlington .
a man 's now been arrested on sus of handling stolen goods .
police say they want to reunite the items with their owners .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: police chief targets town 's drug problem as priority
text: there 's a fresh dawn over grimsby 's east marsh as a new chief of police in northern lincolnshire vows to take the drug dealers out .
over the last few months there have been a number of drugs raids in grimsby 's east marsh , where residents have described living in fear .
ch supt christine wilson says humberside police is focused on wiping-out the problem and taking apart organised crime gangs .
author: Amanda White
BBC East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: will hull be base for £ 600m new 4x4 vehicle plant ?
text: hull could be the home of a proposed new factory to build the successor to one of britain 's best-known off road vehicles .
chemicals firm ineos say it 's looking to build 25,000 vehicles a year from 2020 , along the lines of the famed land rover defender which went out of production last year .
there 's been lots of interest from potential sites across europe to base production there , but ineos say their preferred site is in the uk , somewhere between hull and scotland .
the founder of ineos , jim ratcliffe grew up in beverley .
the £ 600m project would employ 1,000 people directly and ineos say another 10,000 jobs could be created indirectly .
jaguar land rover has also recently announced plans to build a replacement for the defender .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: resort taxi firm offers residents reassurance
text: there are still plenty of taxis in bridlington , despite the closure of the town 's biggest private hire firm .
that 's according to chris officer , who runs one of bridlington 's remaining taxis companies .
it follows last week 's dramatic closure of the taxi firm q-cars after it was stripped of its operators licence last week due to safeguarding and public protection issues .
its sudden enforced closure has left taxi drivers relying on getting work off taxi ranks , though some have signed up with other companies .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: misconduct hearing in immingham for four councillors
text: accusations of misconduct against four immingham town councillors will be heard today .

a standards hearing panel at north east lincolnshire council will be held after a number of complaints were made against the behaviour of councillors dave watson , mike burton , kevin houghton and david bolton by the town council clerk .
they deny the claims by dave jackson that they 've been undermining him and the council .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: through the lens of larkin
text: you might know philip larkin best as a famous poet who lived and worked in hull for many years , but did you also know he was an avid photographer ?
in fact he was actually an early pioneer of the 'selfie ' !
there 's a special bbc programme - `` through the lens of larkin '' -about his lifelong passion for photograph on bbc1 tonight at 19:00 .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: travel updates from eyms
text: here 's the latest updates on delays to the buses from east yorkshire motor services around hull , due to roadworks :
hull : services 103/115 already starting to be delayed by the newland ave diversion/congestion , delays of up to 15mins at the mo .
# now
roadworks at woodmansey/dunswell causing delays of up to 20 minutes for services 121 , 122 and 246 .
sorry for your extra journey time .
# now
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: happy birthday to grimsby police station
text: grimsby 's police station is 60 years old today .
it was built with 14 cells for men and 6 for women and all the mod cons of 1950 's policing .
there were 168 sergeants and constables .
six of those were women .
there were 195 special officers .
i went along to a celebration at the police station yesterday and met 86-year-old len rayner , one of the original serving officers .
len told me he worked here till he retired in 1983 and says in those days , because they walked the streets , they saw much more than if they were in a car .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: gas cloud over hull docks cleared
text: air quality has returned to within safe levels after a major acid leak at hull docks .
a tank containing nearly 600 tonnes of hydrochloric acid caused a vapour cloud , below , at the docks in the early hours of yesterday morning .
following the incident , eight people reported signs of feeling unwell and four were taken to hospital for assessment .
they have now been given the all-clear .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : find out if you 'll need a brolly today
text: possibly a damp start in some places but it should be a largely dry and bright day .
here 's the full forecast :

Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: morning , gill here with all the latest updates on the news , sport , travel and weather across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
i 'll be with you till 18:00 today and if you want to share any stories or like this one from one of our weather watchers , you can get in touch via email , facebook or twitter .

BBC Local Live

text: patel leads bears recovery against yorks

documents.title: five things we 've learned today :
text: that 's all from me for today , but any breaking news will continue to be posted here overnight .
before i go , here 's five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire fighters back at scene of dock acid leak
text: the operation to safely remove acid that leaked from a tanker in king george dock overnight , could take several hours to complete .
it 's thought 22 specialist tankers will be needed to remove all the hydrochloric acid .
humberside fire and rescue say it could be the early hours of the morning before a cordon is lifted and people working within that area are allowed to leave their offices .
a change in wind direction means the vapour created as the acid is decanted is now hanging over the dock area .
firefighters are using what they call a water curtain to contain the gas cloud .
i 've been speaking to matthew sutcliffe from humberside fire and rescue :
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : chance of the odd bit of rain
text: it will turn cloudy tonight with perhaps a few spots of rain for a time and lows of around 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow could see a damp start in some places , otherwise it will be a mostly dry and bright day with sunny spells .
it will feel warm with highs around 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: dozens of football fans guilty of affray
text: two police officers were injured in clashes at a pre-season grimsby town and sheffield united match .

documents.title: breakingroads around king george dock 'not affected by vapour cloud '
text: humberside police say they are supporting emergency services at the scene of the acid spill at king george dock in hull .
overnight 580 tonnes of hydrochloric acid leaked into the dock area .
a change in wind direction now meas a vapour cloud is hanging over the dock area while the clear up operation is ongoing .
fire fighters are using what they call a water curtain to contain it .
police say the roads around the dock are not affected at this time , but a cordon has been put in place within some parts of the docks .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: acid leak - cordon in place around king george dock
text: firecrews are back at king george dock in hull this afternoon after an acid leak overnight .
a change in wind direction now means a vapour cloud is over the site .
humberside fire and rescue are using a water curtain to contain the gas .
associated british ports say that because of the vapour cloud an exclusion zone has been put in place .
anyone working from within the cordon wo n't be able to leave the site until its been deemed safe to do so .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingfirecrews back at docks over acid leak - gas cloud now a problem
text: firecrews have been called back to king george dock after an acid leak in the early hours of this morning .
they 're working to help contain a gas cloud that formed after 580 tonnes of hydrochloric acid leaked into the dock area .
a change in wind direction means crews now need to contain the cloud and are using what they call a water curtain which is a fine mist sprayed over the cloud to contain it .
humberside fire and rescue say this is precautionary and they have cordoned off an exclusion zone around the site .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: amy 's final moth to be revealed
text: you might remember the moths ( for amy that appeared around hull and east yorkshire last year .
well now the 60th and final moth to celebrate the life of aviator amy johnson is to be unveiled .
amy johnson was the first woman pilot to fly solo from england to australia .
the design is not being revealed just yet but will form the center piece of saffron waghorn 's exhibition `` in suspension '' .
the `` mystery moth '' was designed and built by both saffron and her colleague jo cruickshanks and is called eco-moth .
here 's a little peek at what to expect when you visit the exhibition at jubilee central on king edward street from tuesday 26 september :
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: new deputy chief constable announced
text: humberside police have appointed a new deputy chief constable .
chris rowley ( is moving from west yorkshire police .
he says he wants to help deliver an outstanding service to the communities across the force area .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council to ask whitehall for 'tens of millions ' for cruise ship terminal
text: council officials in hull are asking the government for tens of millions of pounds to build a cruise terminal .
they say the development will bring thousands of tourists into the city and millions of pounds to local attractions and businesses .
but some people living nearby the planned terminal on victoria dock say it 's not the right place and will bring pollution and traffic misery .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: can you help find missing raymond clarkson ?
text: there 's concern for the safety of a missing man from hutton cranswick near driffield .
raymond clarkson , who 's 38-years-old , was last seen on friday , 15 september .
police are asking anyone who has seen him or knows where he is to get in touch .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sport : hull kingston rovers
text: hull kingston rovers skipper shaun lunt has been named championship player of the season .
the 30-year-old hooker was honoured in manchester for leading his team back into the super league .
the club was also named as the championship team of the year following promotion .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: watch : hull docks acid leak - latest
text: the advice to people living near king george dock in hull is to keep their doors and windows closed while the clear-up operation continues , after an acid leak .
around 50 firefighters have been dealing with the incident overnight .
crews say the emergency phase of the incident is now over .
the leak came from a tank containing 580 tonnes of hydrochloric acid .
it 's not clear how much spilled out .
our correspondent paul murphy has been following this story :
the environment agency and the health and safety executive are now working on site .
they are trying to find out what caused the leak and if there has been any environmental impact .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: more strike action announced on northern services
text: another strike on northern rail services has been confirmed across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
the rmt union confirms workers on arriva rail north are to strike on 3 and 5 october in disputes over the role of guards and driver only trains .
author: Andy Comfort
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: man dies after single vehicle crash in grimsby
text: a man 's died after the car he was in left the road and hit a tree in grimsby .
the 27-year-old was a passenger in the car when it crashed just after 19:00 on saturday evening on tetney road in humberston .
the driver of the blue volvo v40 and two other passengers suffered minor injuries and were treated at the scene .
police are asking for anyone with information to get in touch via the 101 number .
author: Lara King
North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: major roadworks suspended for hull fair
text: major roadworks on newland avenue in hull will be suspended next month to allow access to hull fair .
newland avenue is currently being resurfaced and the council says the work is ahead of schedule .
the decision 's been made to temporarily reopen the road for two weeks from monday , 2 october .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: concern over missing man from scunthorpe
text: police are concerned for the safety of a missing scunthorpe man because he may be in need of medical attention .
christian thompson , aged 44 , ( from the town was last seen on saturday at 13:00 bst .
humberside police say he may have travelled to scarborough .
he is around 6ft tall of thin build and bald and was last seen wearing a baseball cap , grey hooded top with blue jeans and trainers .
police are urging anyone with information to get in touch .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cigarette smuggling lorry driver jailed for 18 weeks
text: a romanian lorry driver has been caught trying to smuggle over 34,000 cigarettes worth almost £ 10,000 in duty taxes , in to the uk through hull ferry port .
mihai gavrea hid the cigarettes ( in aluminium boards in his trailer on 27 august 2017 .
the 30-year-old , who was arrested by uk border force officers was sentenced to 18 weeks in prison at hull crown court .
gavrea wanted to undercut legitimate businesses to line his own pockets .
he knew he was committing a crime and was wrong to think he could get away with it . ''
if you 've got any information regarding the smuggling , storage or sale of illegal tobacco you can contact hmrc 's fraud hotline on 0800 788 887 .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: fracking equipment set to arrive on site
text: specialist equipment is being moved on to a fracking site in north yorkshire today .
protesters were moved away from the entrance to the site in kirby misperton yesterday after causing an obstruction .
third energy was granted permission to carry out the technique of extracting gas from shale last may .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: breakingemergency phase of acid leak at king george dock 'now over '
text: humberside fire and rescue say the emergency phase of their operation is now over .
overnight a tank with 580 tonnes of hydrochloric acid leaked into king george dock .
fifty fire fighters have been dealing with what they called a `` major leak '' .
the environment agency say they do n't believe the acid leaked into the humber .
emergency phase over at king george dock , hull incident .
crews wore gas tight suits when dealing with acid leak .
good job guys/girls
bit close to home
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: court appearance for football hooligans
text: seventeen men are due at hull crown court today following trouble at a grimsby town pre-season friendly match in july .
they were charged with violent disorder offences when they clashed with sheffield united supporters and humberside police after the game .
two police officers were injured during the disturbance .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: abnormal load heading towards brigg
text: if you get stuck in traffic between immingham and brigg this morning - this could be why :
humberside police say the abnormal load is 300 tonnes in weight , 52 metres long and four metres wide !
expect delays .
# abload movement travelling from immingham to brigg this morning .

what a funny bloke
nice stance of the motorbike police man

North East Lincolnshire reporter

documents.title: hull-based sailing charity to help grimsby families
text: the hull-based sailing charity catzero ( that helps young unemployed people is going to start working with vulnerable families in north east lincolnshire .
they 've teamed up with grimsby based cpo , which helps families approaching crisis .
and they 've got £ 340,000 from the big lottery fund to help improve the lives of 100 families in grimsby 's east marsh , west marsh and south wards over the next three years .
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: headlines across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire
text: headlines across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: a fine day after a chilly start .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: live coverage for east yorkshire and the humber
text: morning , gill here with all the latest updates on your news , weather , sport and travel across east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire .
we 'll keep you up to date with any developments following the hydrochloric acid leak at king george dock in hull overnight .
in the meantime , we 'll start with this misty but bright from one of our weather watchers of owston ferry this morning :
if you want to get in touch with your stories or you can contact us via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire crews from across city involved in hull docks acid leak op
text: fire crews from across hull and specialist chemical units were involved in dealing with a `` major '' acid leak at king george dock , humberside fire and rescue service has confirmed .
the leak from a tank containing nearly 600 tonnes of hydrochloric acid happened late last night with fire crews taking several hours to bring it under control .
local residents were warned to keep windows and doors shut due to a vapour cloud caused by the leak , but no homes were evacuated .
the incident has now been `` scaled down '' , according to the fire service , with crews now working with the environment agency at the scene .
however , it 's not yet clear how much acid has been spilled into the dock .

documents.title: acid leak operation at hull docks 'scaled down '
text: an incident at hull docks which saw hydrochloric acid leaking from a tank at king george dock has been `` scaled down '' , according to humberside fire and rescue service .
at its height late last night and the early hours of this morning , about 50 firefighters tackled the leak and local residents were asked to close doors and windows due to the vapour cloud :
control - leak at king george dock now contained .
vapour cloud reducing and incident being scaled down. # redwatch

documents.title: 'major ' acid leak at hull docks brought under control
text: a `` major '' acid leak at hull docks has been contained , according to humberside fire and rescue service .
fire crews were called to king george dock late on monday evening after reports of a leak in a tank containing 580 tonnes of hydrochloric acid .
local residents were asked to close their doors and windows after the leak caused a vapour cloud over the site .
about 50 firefighters were called to deal with the incident at the east end of the dock , with waste land to the side of it .
no homes were evacuated and the leak was contained by about 04:20 this morning , the fire service says .

documents.title: five things we learned
text: thank you for joining us today .
we 'll be back with you tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
before i go , lets have a look at five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: concerns over future of council building
text: there 's concern about the future of a listed council building in north lincolnshire .
the council are moving out of pitwood house and hope to sell the 1960 's building .
but there are fears that it will be difficult for any developers to buy the building because of its grade two listed status .
however leader of north lincolnshire council rob waltham is confident someone will want the building .
from our perspective , we clearly want it to be appreciated for years to come and we want a partner to come in buy it , locate with it and make sure they love it as much as the council has .
author: Laura Foster
BBC Look North

documents.title: royal ballet performance reopens hull new theatre
text: hull 's biggest theatre has reopened after a £ 16m refurbishment , with a specially-choreographed performance by the royal ballet .
the opening performance on saturday at the hull new theatre , which shut last year , featured a show by hull-born royal ballet director kevin o'hare .
other world-renowned dancers from hull who danced in opening the new included xander parish and his sister demelza .
xander originally trained at hull 's skelton hooper school of dance .
he became the first briton to be a principal dancer at russia 's mariinsky ballet .
author: Anne-Marie Tasker
BBC Look North

documents.title: the headlines this evening
text: here are the headlines from look north this evening .
the latest headlines from the @ twitterid team with @ twitterid more on bbc one @ 18:30 .
peter , should n't the council sort out the a63 before undertaking another big project that will lead to more traffic chaos ?
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: man arrested over queen 's gardens assault
text: a 20-year-old man is in custody on sus of the assault of a 25 year-old hull man who was attacked in queen gardens in hull at around 01:00 on sunday .
the victim was found with head injuries and taken to hull royal infirmary for treatment .
he is now recovering at home .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: east riding theatre announces new play
text: east riding theatre has announced they will stage a production of hull playwright richard bean 's 'kiss me ' at the beginning of october .
it 's the first time the play has been shown outside of london .
the play is described as beautiful and unorthodox love story about two people struggling to escape the guilt and ghosts of the past .
we 're really pleased to be putting on kiss me .
richard has been a great supporter of the theatre since its beginning and became one of our ambassadors in 2014 .
kiss me is an intriguing and rib-tickling two hander that i think will work wonderfully in the intimate atmosphere at east riding theatre .

documents.title: weather forecast : a cloudy day with some showers
text: cloudy with showery rain during the evening , this eventually clearing away after midnight to drier conditions with just the odd shower .
becoming chilly under clear intervals with light winds , perhaps leading to some areas of mist and fog by dawn .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hull truck nominated for national award
text: hull truck theatre has been nominated for a national award .
they 've been nominated for the category of achievement in marketing and audience development award .
the awards will be presented on sunday 15 october at a ceremony at london 's guildhall ,
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: kcom stadium company responds to penalty spot claims
text: the company which manages the kcom stadium has responded to claims that the pitch was n't sufficiently prepared for hull city 's match against sunderland at the weekend .
it 's been alleged that there were no penalty spots marked in either of the boxes .
management company smc says that the way that the penalty spots are now marked involves a hollow circle rather than the traditional large white spot .
they say this is to reduce the amount of paint on the pitch which damages the grass .
they go on to say that they 're disappointed that people have chosen to question the work standards of staff without being properly informed of the situation .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: hull wont 'drop the ball ' on securing culture legacy
text: the chair of hull city of culture says they wo n't drop the ball on ensuring the year leaves a legacy .
rosie millard told bbc radio humberside they 're raising funds to ensure 2017 continues to have an impact .
she says hull 2017 has created a positive feeling in the city :
it has been just remarkable .
the figures for public engagement have been astonishing .
the joy in the city , you can feel it .
author: Kofi Smiles
BBC Face of Hull 2017

documents.title: mum 's 'terrifying ' attack on stepchild
text: mum 's 'terrifying ' attack on stepchild

documents.title: man suffers head injuries in robbery
text: a 25-year-old man was left with head injuries following a serious assault in hull on sunday morning .
the incident happened at queens gardens in hull at around 01:00 on sunday .
it was two hours before he was found unconscious .
he was taken to hull royal infirmary and is now recovering at home .
a black apple iphone 7 , house keys , wallet and lighter was stolen in the incident .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: cycling cafe moves step closer to securing future
text: a popular cycling cafe in beverley faces a more secure future after planners today recommended it should be granted a permanent licence .
cafe velo had applied for a permanent licence , but it was initially recommended for refusal , following concerns from a couple of local residents .
a campaign was launched by cyclists and people living locally .
the council received more than 100 letters in support of the cafe .
planning documents out today reveal that the cafe 's licence has been recommended for approval , with a final decision being made by a committee next week .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: council 'confident ' over cruise terminal
text: council leaders in hull say they 're very confident a £ 55m cruise terminal in the city will become a reality .
following on from its success as the uk city of culture , councillors say hull is back on the map .
hopes are now high the government will back the development .
author: Katy Austin
BBC Look North

documents.title: rise in visitor numbers to cleethorpes
text: there 's been a 10 % rise in visitor numbers to cleethorpes this summer compared to last year .
that 's what the leader of north east lincolnshire council has told us .
it comes as businesses in the resort say they 've seen an increase in trade too .
there were originally fears that tourism numbers could be hit because of the closure of the pleasure island theme park .
author: Caroline Brockelbank
BBC Local Live

documents.title: scunthorpe rooftop man in court
text: a man who took to the roof of a house in a bid to escape police arrest has admitted a number of offences .
kyle ferguson , 23 , of salisbury close , scunthorpe , was wanted by humberside police and was detained after a rooftop stand-off near his home last month .

at grimsby crown court today he pleaded guilty to various charges including three counts of affray , one count of racially or religiously aggravated intentional harassment and another of having a blade or sharply pointed article in a public place .
ferguson has been remanded in custody until 29 september when he is due to be sentenced at the same court .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC News Online

documents.title: your headlines this lunch time
text: your headlines this lunch time
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: 'queen of the tea towel ' dies aged 87
text: a woman from hull who was known as the queen of the tea towel has died at the age of 87 .
pat albeck became famous for her textile designs and had a long association with the department store john lewis and the national trust .
she went to art school in hull and held an affection for the city even after leaving for london .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: calls for speed cameras on hull road
text: someone will be killed if nothing 's done soon to make a main route into hull safer , says a hull councillor .
councillor sean chaytor wants to see speed cameras installed on hedon road .
the 40mph stretch , which has multiple roundabouts , links the city centre to the holderness plain and has been the site of numerous crashes in recent years .
the problem is we got a wonderful new road a few years ago designed for vehicles driving 40 miles per hour .
some lorries are going as fast at 60 miles per hour ''
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: badly drawn boy to perform at hull festival
text: mercury music prize winning band badly drawn boy and an award winning hip hop theatre show have been added to hull 's `` back to ours '' festival line up this autumn .
the festival was designed to take city of culture shows to different parts of the hull .
venues include the north point shopping centre and archbishop sentamu academy .
the shows take place at the end of october and the start of november .
author: Richard Madden
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: union to ballot council workers over free parking passes
text: union leaders say hull city council staff could take strike action after the authority cancelled free car parking passes .
radio humberside has been told the passes , which expire at the end of the month , are essential for staff that need to travel around the area .
but the council says drivers will be given 65p per mile and it 's also introducing a pool car scheme .
nikki osborne of the union unison says it 's inadequate .
in 2015 when we went to consult on this , that 's what we were looking at was pool cars and rolling them out .
they have done barely anything about it and now we find ourselves in this position .
we have a handful of pool cars that they 're trialling at the moment ''
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: cars crash off road in oil spill
text: a suspected oil spill has caused four vehicles to come off the road and three others to spin out of control near kirton lindsey in north lincolnshire .
there was one minor injury to one person .
the road has been closed to allow the vehicles to be recovered and the road cleaned .
author: Simon Spark
Video Journalist

documents.title: grimsby mp wants 'positive ' changes at health trust
text: grimsby 's mp wants to see lasting changes in the trust that runs hospitals in the town , as well as scunthorpe and goole .
in april , the northern lincolnshire and goole hospital trust ( nlag ) became the first trust in the country to re-enter special measures after inspectors found patient safety and care had worsened .
melanie onn has met senior health officials in government seeking reassurances over a turnaround .
coming out of special measures should not be the sole objective .
the objective has to be about making sure there is improvement and that improvement is properly embedded .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: man seriously hurt in early hours car accident
text: a man has been seriously injured after he was thrown from a car in a crash on boothferry road , in hull , during the early hours of the morning .
humberside police say they were called out just before 3am after an accident involving a vauxhall astra , another vehicle , and a tree .
officers think the vauxhall astra was stolen in a burglary along with a black volkswagen golf .
the volkswagen golf has not been found .
the road remains closed and police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North

documents.title: concerns over state of smaller parks in hull
text: there are fears that damaged play equipment in some of hull 's smaller parks wo n't be repaired or replaced .
it 's thought a lack of funding and a cut in council budgets are to blame .
hull culture and leisure is responsible for the day-to-day management for the city 's 96 parks on behalf of the council .
they say if repairs to play equipment are identified then they are prioritised and repaired by them , as safety is paramount .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: travel news : accident closes boothferry road
text: the a1105 boothferry road remains closed in anlaby due to a serious accident , between askew avenue and anlaby park road .
the road has been closed by the costello stadium and sirius academy west since the early hours , with no estimated re-opening time .
local buses are diverting and traffic on clive sullivan way inbound is worse than normal .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: yorkshire devolution 'a step closer '
text: the leader of hull city council believes a devolution deal for the whole of yorkshire is a step closer .
it would give the county more power over local decisions , extra money and an elected mayor .

councillor stephen brady says 17 local authority leaders in the county have now backed a `` one yorkshire '' proposal , including doncaster and barnsley , who were previously part of a separate sheffield city region deal .
a meeting is taking place in south yorkshire today to discuss the options for that area , with sheffield and rotherham still keen on a separate deal to the rest of yorkshire .
i do think the very name of yorkshire and the clout it would have in the wider political world would be a real boost to everyone in yorkshire .
author: David Harrison
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your weather forecast
text: a dry , bright start for most .
some showers are expected later .
here 's the full weather forecast :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: live coverage for east yorkshire and the humber
text: hello and welcome to the local live news feed for east yorkshire and the humber .
i am jonathan and i will be bringing you the latest news , sport and travel throughout the day .
please feel free to get in contact with us via facebook , twitter or email .
author: Jonathan Willis
BBC Look North
